pages.title: Kinematic Components
pages.text: Overview $(br2)Kinematic variants of Servo Motors/Physical Pistons.$(br)Powerful but potentially unstable.
Interaction $(br2)$(li)Sneak + Right Click to assemble blocks above into a physical structure (similar to Clockwork physics bearings). Glue not supported.$(li)Use a wrench to adjust orientation.

pages.title: Control Panel
pages.text: Right Click with an empty hand to open the control panel.

Main Panel $(br2)Displays basic settings:$(li)Current: Real-time relative angle (position)/angular velocity (speed) (radians/radians per second or blocks/blocks per second)$(li)Target: Desired angle/angular velocity (radians/radians per second)$(li)Mode: Select Angle or Angular Velocity target

Advanced Panel $(li)Compliance: Machine stops updating constraints when position/angle error falls below 10^value. Default -5 = error < 1e-5$(li)Offset (First Line): Axis offset relative to default position for next assembly$(li)Offset (Second Line): Controlled structure's axis offset for next assembly
Redstone Panel $(br2)Configurable parameter: Target value. Supports multiple channel binding. See Redstone Channels documentation.
Remote Panel $(br2)Manual controls:$(li)Assembly (equivalent to Sneak + Right Click)$(li)Disconnect

Warnings $(br2)Kinematic machines ignore physics with consequences:$(li)Never destroy connected structures without disassembly first - use Disconnect or break machine before deletion to avoid physics thread crash (VS engine limitation)$(li)Strong recoil requires base to be static or significantly heavier than controlled structure to prevent oscillations
